What advantage do IgM and IgA antibodies: They can bind multiple antigens, potentially offering broader neutralization
They are easier to produce and have a longer half-life
They have a higher affinity for the ACE2 receptor
They are more stable at room temperature
What is a key benefit of bispecific anti: They can target multiple epitopes, reducing the risk of viral escape
They are less expensive to produce than monoclonal antibodies
They have a longer half-life than single-domain antibodies
They are more effective at inducing systemic immunity
What is the primary target for neutraliz: The receptor-binding domain (RBD) of the spike protein
The N-terminal domain (NTD) of the spike protein
The S2 subunit of the spike protein
The nucleocapsid protein of the virus
